com.xd.cps2002.map

Class BasicMapTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xd.cps2002.map.BasicMapTest

  • public class BasicMapTest
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains unit tests used to test both the methods of the abstract Map class and the concrete BasicMap class.

      void generate_generatesCorrectNumberOfWaterTiles_whenPercentagesHaveBeenSetToMaximumInASmallMap()

      void generate_generatesCorrectNumberOfWaterTiles_whenWaterToTilePercentagesHaveBeenChanged()
      This unit checks that the function BasicMap.generate() correctly adjusts the number of water tiles that it generates when the function BasicMap.setWaterTilePercentage(int, int) is used to change the minimum and maximum percentages of water tiles.
      void generate_generatesCorrectNumberOfWaterTiles_whenWaterToTilePercentagesHaveBeenChangedToBeEqual()
      This unit test checks the edge case when the function BasicMap.generate() is fixed at a specific ratio of water tiles by setting both of the parameters in BasicMap.setWaterTilePercentage(int, int) to the same percentage.
      void generate_generatesNoWaterTiles_whenWaterToTilePercentagesAreBothZero()
      This unit test checks the edge case when the function BasicMap.generate() is set to not generate any water tiles by setting both of the parameters in BasicMap.setWaterTilePercentage(int, int) to 0%.

      • generate_generatesCorrectNumberOfWaterTiles_whenWaterToTilePercentagesHaveBeenChanged

        public void generate_generatesCorrectNumberOfWaterTiles_whenWaterToTilePercentagesHaveBeenChanged()
        This unit checks that the function BasicMap.generate() correctly adjusts the number of water tiles that it generates when the function BasicMap.setWaterTilePercentage(int, int) is used to change the minimum and maximum percentages of water tiles.

      • generate_generatesCorrectNumberOfWaterTiles_whenWaterToTilePercentagesHaveBeenChangedToBeEqual

        public void generate_generatesCorrectNumberOfWaterTiles_whenWaterToTilePercentagesHaveBeenChangedToBeEqual()
        This unit test checks the edge case when the function BasicMap.generate() is fixed at a specific ratio of water tiles by setting both of the parameters in BasicMap.setWaterTilePercentage(int, int) to the same percentage.

      • generate_generatesNoWaterTiles_whenWaterToTilePercentagesAreBothZero

        public void generate_generatesNoWaterTiles_whenWaterToTilePercentagesAreBothZero()
        This unit test checks the edge case when the function BasicMap.generate() is set to not generate any water tiles by setting both of the parameters in BasicMap.setWaterTilePercentage(int, int) to 0%.

      • generate_generatesCorrectNumberOfWaterTiles_whenPercentagesHaveBeenSetToMaximumInASmallMap

        public void generate_generatesCorrectNumberOfWaterTiles_whenPercentagesHaveBeenSetToMaximumInASmallMap()
        This unit test is meant to show that map generate still works in the absolute worst case: when you have a 5 x 5 sized map and want to have 64% of the tiles in the map be water tiles. Even with the restriction that water tiles cannot be placed next to the treasure tile, this case should always work. However, if the user could set the percentage to even 1% higher, the function might deadlock since it may not have enough space to place the remaining tile (assuming that 9 tiles are taken up by the treasure tile and its adjacent tiles).

      • setWaterTilePercentage_throwsIllegalArgumentException_ifMinimumPercentageIsNegative

        public void setWaterTilePercentage_throwsIllegalArgumentException_ifMinimumPercentageIsNegative()

        public void setWaterTilePercentage_throwsIllegalArgumentException_ifMinimumPercentageIsLargerThan64()

      • setWaterTilePercentage_throwsIllegalArgumentException_ifMaximumPercentageIsNegative

        public void setWaterTilePercentage_throwsIllegalArgumentException_ifMaximumPercentageIsNegative()

      • setWaterTilePercentage_throwsIllegalArgumentException_ifMaximumPercentageIsLargerThan64

        public void setWaterTilePercentage_throwsIllegalArgumentException_ifMaximumPercentageIsLargerThan64()

      • setWaterTilePercentage_throwsIllegalArgumentException_ifMinimumPercentageIsLargerThanMaximumPercentage

        public void setWaterTilePercentage_throwsIllegalArgumentException_ifMinimumPercentageIsLargerThanMaximumPercentage()

      • isPlayable_returnsTrue_IfTheTreasureCanBeReachedFrom75PercentOfTiles

        public void isPlayable_returnsTrue_IfTheTreasureCanBeReachedFrom75PercentOfTiles()

      • isPlayable_returnsFalse_IfTheTreasureCannotBeReachedFrom75PercentOfTiles

        public void isPlayable_returnsFalse_IfTheTreasureCannotBeReachedFrom75PercentOfTiles()

      • isPlayable_throwsANullPointerException_ifTreasurePosMemberHasNotBeenSet

        public void isPlayable_throwsANullPointerException_ifTreasurePosMemberHasNotBeenSet()

      • isPlayable_correctlyAdjustsItsResult_WhenTheMinimumPercentageOfPlayableTilesIsChanged

        public void isPlayable_correctlyAdjustsItsResult_WhenTheMinimumPercentageOfPlayableTilesIsChanged()
        This unit test is meant to check that changing the minimum percentage of playable tiles using BasicMap.setWaterTilePercentage(int, int) has an effect on the result of the function BasicMap.isPlayable(). The test case is almost exactly the same as isPlayable_returnsFalse_IfTheTreasureCannotBeReachedFrom75PercentOfTiles(), except for the fact that BasicMap.setWaterTilePercentage(int, int) is called. Thus, any changes in the outcome of calling BasicMap.isPlayable() should be only due to calling this function.

      • isPlayable_returnsTrue_WhenItChecksIfAMapWithOnlyGrassTilesIs100PercentPlayable

        public void isPlayable_returnsTrue_WhenItChecksIfAMapWithOnlyGrassTilesIs100PercentPlayable()
        This test is used to test the edge case when the map is set to be 100% playable. In such a case, BasicMap.isPlayable() should only return true if the map only contains no water tiles.

      • isPlayable_returnsFalse_WhenItChecksIfAMapWithSomeWaterTilesIs100PercentPlayable

        public void isPlayable_returnsFalse_WhenItChecksIfAMapWithSomeWaterTilesIs100PercentPlayable()
        This test is almost exactly the same to the isPlayable_returnsTrue_WhenItChecksIfAMapWithOnlyGrassTilesIs100PercentPlayable(). The only difference is that now a water tile was added to the map, such that it is no longer 100% playable. Hence, the function should now return false.

      • isPlayable_returnsTrue_WhenItChecksIfAMapWithTheMinimumNumberNumberOfGrassTilesIs1Playable

        public void isPlayable_returnsTrue_WhenItChecksIfAMapWithTheMinimumNumberNumberOfGrassTilesIs1Playable()
        This test was added to check if the function works correctly when only 1% (the minimum) of the map is playable.

      • setMinPlayableTilesPercentage_throwsIllegalArgumentException_IfPercentageIsLessThan1

        public void setMinPlayableTilesPercentage_throwsIllegalArgumentException_IfPercentageIsLessThan1()

      • setMinPlayableTilesPercentage_throwsIllegalArgumentException_IfPercentageIsLargerThan100

        public void setMinPlayableTilesPercentage_throwsIllegalArgumentException_IfPercentageIsLargerThan100()
